Gundersen Health System launched its end of life care program , Respecting Choices , back in 1993 .
Since then , hospitals across the country have adopted it .
It can help patients do good planning and improve the outcome for those patients and their families , said Bud Hammes , Respecting Choices director .

Respecting Choices has had a big impact here in La Crosse - more than 90 percent of the city 's residents die with some sort of plan in place , according to Gundersen officials .

A group of people representing six European countries - the United Kingdom , Amsterdam , Belgium , Denmark , Italy and Slovania - are at Gundersen this week to learn the ins and outs of Respecting Choices .
